info.title: Event Portal
info.description:
REST API Concepts

Solace PubSub+ Event Portal provides REST APIs that you can use to manage your data in PubSub+ Cloud. 
The REST APIs allow you to model your event-driven architectures from your own client applications.

The following document describes the public REST APIs available for use in Event Portal 2.0. Objects created in this 
version will not be available in Event Portal 1.0. APIs that display (Beta) in their summary are provided as-is and 
are subject to change or removal. They may not be of the quality expected for generally available APIs and have no 
guaranteed forward compatibility with the generally available version of the API.

get.summary: Get a list of enumerations
get.description:
Use this API to get a list of enumerations based on certain criteria.

Token Permissions: [ `event_designer:access` ]

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of enumerations to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: The IDs of the enumerations.

parameters.name: applicationDomainId
parameters.description: The application domain ID of the enumerations.

parameters.name: applicationDomainIds
parameters.description: Match only enumerations in the given application domain ids.

parameters.name: names
parameters.description: The names of the enumerations.

parameters.name: shared
parameters.description: Match only with shared or unshared enumerations.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort based on the provided parameters.
The value can be either a standalone field name (`?sort=`) or a field and direction, delimited by a colon (`?sort=:`). If the direction is not specified, the default is ascending.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter supports custom attribute values containing only the characters `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.

200.description: Get a list of enumerations and the accompanying metadata.

post.description:
An enumeration is a bounded variable with a limited set of literal values. Use this API to create an enumeration to define acceptable values for a level in a topic address or topic domain.

Token Permissions: [ `ep_enum:create:*` ]

201.description: Created an enumeration. The newly saved enumeration is returned in the response body.

get.summary: Get a list of events
get.description:
Use this API to get a list of events that match the given parameters.

Token Permissions: [ `event_designer:access` ]

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of events to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the event to match on.

parameters.name: shared
parameters.description: Match only with shared or unshared events.

parameters.name: brokerType
parameters.description: Match only events with the given broker type

parameters.name: applicationDomainId
parameters.description: Match only events in the given application domain.

parameters.name: applicationDomainIds
parameters.description: Match only events in the given application domain ids.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort based on the provided parameters.
The value can be either a standalone field name (`?sort=`) or a field and direction, delimited by a colon (`?sort=:`). If the direction is not specified, the default is ascending.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter supports custom attribute values containing only the characters `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only events with the given IDs separated by commas.

200.description: Get a list of events and the accompanying metadata.

post.description:
Events are the primary building block of an event-driven architecture. Applications publish and subscribe to events and events reference schemas. In the Event Portal, an event is a type of event as opposed to a specific event instance.

Token Permissions: [ `event:create:*` ]

requestBody.description: The event requires a name and an application domain ID.

201.description: Created an event. The newly saved event is returned in the response body.

parameters.description:
Sort based on the provided parameters.
The value can be either a standalone field name (`?sort=`) or a field and direction, delimited by a colon (`?sort=:`). If the direction is not specified, the default is ascending.

To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.

The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.

parameters.description: The ID of the enumeration.

parameters.description: The ID of the enumeration.

200.description: Updated an enumeration. The newly saved enumeration is returned in the response body.

get.summary: Get a list of audit results
get.description:
This provides a list of audit results for the given event mesh and/or event brokers.

Token Permissions: [ `audit:read` ]

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of audit records to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: eventBrokerIds
parameters.description: Match only audit records belonging to the given event brokers.

parameters.name: eventMeshId
parameters.description: Match only audit records belonging to the given event mesh.

parameters.name: auditEntityTypes
parameters.description: Match only audit records belonging to the given entity types.

parameters.name: statuses
parameters.description: Match only audit records with the given statuses.

parameters.name: startsWith
parameters.description: Match only audit records with identifiers starting with the given value.

parameters.name: contains
parameters.description: Match audit records with identifiers containing the given value.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort based on the provided parameters.
The value can be either a standalone field name (`?sort=`) or a field and direction, delimited by a colon (`?sort=:`). If the direction is not specified, the default is ascending. Sorting is supported for status and identifier.

200.description: The list of audit records and the accompanying metadata.
